ext_descriptions.ext_description: The tolerance_method_definition type is the identification of the method used to generate a tolerance value.

ext_description.p: A dimension_related_tolerance_zone_element is an association of a tolerance zone definition with a locating dimension.
ext_description.example: A square hole parallel to the 2 axis may be toleranced with distinct positional tolerances in the X and Y directions. Each specified positional tolerance is defined by a tolerance-zone-definition consisting of two parallel planes. The dimension that locates the centre plane of the square hole in the X axis also specifies the location of the two parallel planes defining the positional tolerance in that axis. The dimension_related_tolerance_zone_element is the relationship of this dimension, the related-dimension, to the tolerance zone definition, the two parallel planes.
ext_description.note: The relationship between dimensions and tolerance zone elements is described in 3.4 of IS0 5458.

ext_description.p: A tolerance_value is the representation of plus-minus tolerances for a dimension. A tolerance_value specifies the numeric values added to the nominal dimension of a .

The lower_bound and upper_bound are applied to the value of the dimension to determine the acceptable range of measured values. A tolerance_value may be either assigned by the user or specified according to IS0 286-l and IS0 286-2.
ext_description.example:
Since the only constraint OII the attribute values is that the upper bound be greater than the lower bound, the specification of a
(e.g., 10.0+0.10+0.05) is permitted. In this case, the nominal dimension, 10.0, is not bounded by its associated tolerance zone.
